meanings.definition: The rank or position of a sergeant.
meanings.sent1: In the army, achieving sergeanty requires hard work and dedication.
meanings.sent2: He was proud to be promoted to sergeanty after years of service.
meanings.sent3: The sergeanty of the group was evident in their organized and efficient teamwork.
meanings.sent4: Her leadership style embodied the essence of sergeanty, guiding her team with precision.
meanings.sent5: The sergeanty of the police force was crucial in maintaining law and order in the city.

meanings.sent1: The sergeanty gathered for their annual meeting to discuss important matters.
meanings.sent2: The sergeanty was well-respected for their experience and expertise.
meanings.sent3: During the event, the sergeanty shared stories and jokes, creating a lively atmosphere.
meanings.sent4: The sergeanty worked together seamlessly, each bringing their unique skills to the table.
meanings.sent5: The sergeanty's unity and camaraderie were evident in their joint efforts to serve the community.

meanings.definition: The duties or responsibilities of a sergeant.
meanings.sent1: His sergeanty involved overseeing the training of new recruits.
meanings.sent2: She took on the sergeanty of ensuring the safety of her team during the mission.
meanings.sent3: The sergeanty of maintaining discipline among the troops was a challenging task.
meanings.sent4: In her role, she carried out the sergeanty with diligence and professionalism.
meanings.sent5: The sergeanty of leading by example was crucial in earning the respect of the squad.
